modules.description: This module defines a portal type with a CSS selector and React element content. It provides a context for collecting portals and a `make` function to create portal instances that render content into a specified DOM node. Use it to render React components into arbitrary DOM locations, such as modals or tooltips outside the main component tree.

This module defines providers for injecting portal-related context into a React component tree. It includes functions to create and access contextual values specific to portal components, enabling dynamic configuration and sharing of portal data. Concrete use cases include passing portal-specific rendering logic or state down to nested components without explicit prop drilling.

This module provides a React component factory that collects and manages portal data within a component tree. It works with React elements and portal objects to enable dynamic injection of portal-specific context. Use it to share portal state and rendering logic across nested components without prop drilling.

This module transforms React elements by injecting portal content into a specified DOM node. It provides `collectPortals` to gather portal elements from a component subtree and `appendUniversalPortals` to render them into a target container. Use it to centralize and dynamically manage portal rendering in complex component hierarchies.
